Frank McCown wrote:
>
> I'm attempting to calculate the hop count from the seed to the crawled
> resource by examining the crawl.log produced for each job. I'm simply
> counting the number of consecutive R, E, X, or L's after the URI. For
> example, if crawl.log had
>
> ... http://foo.org/abc.html <http://foo.org/abc.html> LE ...
>
> I would count this as a hop count of 2 from foo.org (assuming that was
> the seed).
>
> Am I overlooking anything?
>










I don't think so.  Its the presumption thats at the core of the 
too-many-hops deciderule -- see 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/deciderules/TooManyHopsDecideRule.html#74 
-- and crawl.log entries only happen apache-style after we've finished 
processing an URL.

St.Ack




>
> Thanks,
> Frank
>
>
